register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3MAIN1_L4_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3MAIN1_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3MAIN1 clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L3MAIN1 domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having OCP master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EVE4 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EVE3 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EVE2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EVE1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor OCP interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards L4PER3 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L4PER2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards PCIE clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards DSP2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards IPU1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards WKUPAON clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L4SEC clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L4PER1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L4CFG clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards GPU clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards DSS clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EMIF clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards IPU clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards IVA clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards DSP1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards IPU2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register manages the L3_MAIN_1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the GPMC clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is temporarily disabled by SW. OCP access to module are stalled. Can be used to change timing parameter of GPMC module.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the TPTC1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the IPU2_GCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the IPU2 clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the static domain depedencies from IPU domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from IPU domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having OCP master port(s).

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor OCP interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards CAM clock domain

register.description: This register manages the IPU2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the DMA clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the EMIF clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register manages the DMM clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the EMIF_OCP_FW clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the EMIF1 clocks.

bitfield.description: Source of EMIF1 External Low Latency interface clock EMIF_LL_GCLK Value is provided by LLI_C2C_SELECT input pin

bitenum.description: EMIF_LL_GCLK is same as C2C clock
EMIF_LL_GCLK is same as LLI clock

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is temporarily disabled by SW. OCP access to module are stalled. Can be used to change timing parameter of EMIF_1 module.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the EMIF2 clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is temporarily disabled by SW. OCP access to module are stalled. Can be used to change timing parameter of EMIF_2 module.

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any OCP access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the DLL clock.

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled. DLL_CLK can be gated when EMIF domain performs sleep transition
Optional functional clock is enabled. DLL_CLK is garantied to not be gated if already running.

register.description: This register manages the ATL clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects source for ATL clock

bitenum.description: Selects L3_ICLK
Selects PER_ABE_X1_CLK
Selects DPLL_CLK from SOURCE1

bitfield.description: Selects source for ATL clock

bitenum.description: Selects FUNC_32K_CLK
Selects VIDEO1_CLK
Selects VIDEO2_CLK
Selects HDMI_CLK

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including OCP
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only OCP part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by SW. Any OCP access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guaranteed to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the ATL_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the ATL_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the C2C clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also hold one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4CFG_L3_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L4CFG_L4_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated
Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L4CFG clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L4CFG domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having OCP master port(s).

bitfield.description: Size of sliding window used to monitor OCP interface activity for determination of auto-sleep feature. Time unit defined byCM_DYN_DEP_PRESCAL register.
Dynamic dependency towards MPU clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards CUSTEFUSE clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards COREAON clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards DMA clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3INIT clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3MAIN1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards EMIF clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

Divide by 16
Divide by 32
